subHeadline: 'Gutfeld' welcomed guests Michael Shellenberger, Julie Banderas, Kat Timpf, Tyrus

utterances.speaker: KAMALA HARRIS, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: It impacts everyone. Everyone who ever you are should care about this issue.

utterances.speaker: LAURA INGRAHAM, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Except the border. Doesn't care much about. Does she? Greg Gutfeld takes it off from here.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: Happy Thursday. America has such great news to report plus, Julie Banderas has hung over. What a surprise. Huh? Am I right? She poured herself into this chair. She looks terrible. But that's OK. We'll give you a little break right now because we're going to have seven jokes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Greg's seven jokes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The both American and Southwest Airlines say they'll comply with President Biden's order to force their employees to be vaccinated. Meanwhile, Spirit Airlines will begin requiring their employees to brush their teeth. Is that too mean? I don't know if that's one. President of the Toy Association said this week that kids might not get what they want this Christmas due to the national shortages. Great. More money to spend on strippers said Dana Perino. Unbelievable pervert that she is. Jon Gruden, you know him, the Raiders coach will be removed from the Buccaneers Ring of Honor over e-mails that contained racist insults, which some say is hypocritical because O.J. Simpson remains in the NFL Hall of Fame but that's an apples to oranges comparison since there's no proof Simpson said mean e-mails. Right?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.sentences: He was acquitted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He was acquainted. The global supply chain crunch has made it hard to find Halloween costumes in stores. So this year Chris Cuomo is going to pretend to be a journalist. Where are we? The number four? Was that number four?? This week William Shatner became the oldest man to travel in space. Scientists suspect the 90-year-old took control of the rocket at some point because it never turned off its turn signal. That's five. Footwear brand Minnetonka has apologized for making moccasins. They've been made them for 75 years because it's not a Native-American owned business. To remedy this problem, the CEO says the company will be changing its name to Elizabeth Warren. Number six. And finally, with Biden's war on energy independence, the price of coal has skyrocketed. So this Christmas all the naughty kids will be getting their stockings filled with solar panels. And that's your seventh joke. Oh. Delicious water, Julie. You might want to have some.

utterances.speaker: JULIE BANDERAS, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, did you know that the New York Mayor Bill de Blasio, otherwise known as a walking tree of turds is removing the statue of Thomas Jefferson from City Hall? In case he went to public schools. Jefferson was a founding father, our third president, but also a slave owner. The statue has been there for nearly 200 years. A year for every screw up de Blasio makes in a week. But after all the problems going on in the city it was clear that this putrid piece of marble had to go. I mean, think about it. A woman was beaten brutally on the city streets stopped repeatedly and left for dead. People are dodging bullets in Times Square like Neo in the Matrix. But damn that Thomas Jefferson, you know, he's behind all that. Of course there was the Filipino nurse murdered Saturday afternoon in Times Square by a deranged criminal. That alleged killer had been released after groping another female. But clearly, if there was no Jefferson statue, this never would have happened. There's a huge spike in homicides in major cities. It's getting so bad in places like Chicago. They are installing bleeding control kits in hundreds of city buildings. Each kit contains supplies like tourniquets, gauze, shears, gloves and an instruction manual. I knew the labor shortage was severe, but now you have to fix your own gunshot wounds. But what do you expect when you allow such statues to exist? Now the removal of the statute was suggested by de Blasio's wife, Chirlane McCray. She said I already share a bed with a blockhead. I don't need another one staring at me while I work. But she also heads up the $800 million taxpayer funded program called Thrive, which was designed to treat the mentally ill like the guy who murdered the nurse. But where's the proof that the program actually did anything? The money disappeared faster than Brian Stelter at a donut factory. If you take a casual drive around the city and you don't get carjacked first, you'll see countless destitute zombies. But it's hard to investigate the person in charge of helping them when it's the mayor's wife. So what do you do when you're supposed to treat the sick and deranged and you haven't done squat? And the people you're supposed to be helping are doing squat everywhere, on the sidewalks, in front of businesses, in the parks with dogs. And that's Julie. So, you go after this statues? And why? How does removing the statues make the poor or the elderly currently being picked off in New York any safer? It doesn't. If anything, with you getting shot at statues give you a place to hide behind. In fact, we can use a lot more statues of really fat people. Grover Cleveland, Henry VIII, hell, I'll take a Michael Moore. I'll take anything because increasingly -- oh, it's a cheap (INAUDIBLE) increasingly, the public has fewer places to hide. But the real reason for removing statues is deflection. The activist class, it's a shallow, stupid breed with absurd priorities, and their leaders know that. All you need to do is dangle some performative act of symbolic justice in front of them, and like a hooker in front of Hunter, they'll climb over it. And then you don't need to do any real work at all. Defund the police, bail out thugs and rapists and watch as your city time travels back to the 1970s and then blame the statues. And a mayor and his wife can coast along by shifting the conversation to erasing the past and call that progress. It's not just New York, whether it's San Francisco, where they're closing down drugstores due to crime, or downtown Portland and during another night of mob violence. All you need to do are a few things. Demand changing the problematic name of a grade school, cancel a holiday for a problematic explorer. Remove a statue of a problematic founder. All of the name of equity and anti-racism. As the elderly and working classes continue to get victimized by thugs and maniacs. It's a good grift as long as you go woke, you're immune from criticism for the horrible messes that you leave behind. I wonder what the angry black male thinks.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Joe Machi, how many times have I told you not to wear my clothes (INAUDIBLE) real funny playing little baby wearing my jacket. I'm tired you guys wearing my clothes. Don't wear my clothes. Time to pay, Joe Machi. Hey, who are you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Hey, Tyrus. I'm Tom Jefferson. Nice to meet you.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Where's Joe?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, Joe is not here today. I don't know. It's my first day. I don't know where Joe is.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You'll do Jefferson.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Someone help me. I don't understand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We all understand. So remove a statue change the holiday's name. Congrats. You've tackled the big problems. And when a parent loses a child or a child loses a parent to a maniac on a city street you can tell them hey, you know, I'm sorry for your loss but remember that busted Jefferson, it's gone as well. So let's call it even.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. He's here to ruin your plans for the apocalypse. Author of the great new book, San Fran-sicko and Apocalypse Never, Michael Shellenberger. She believes a chain is no stronger than its weakest drink. Fox News Anchor Julie Banderas. She gets wasted more than your tax dollars. Fox News Contributor Kat Timpf. Walking a mile in his shoes would only take one step. My massive sidekick and the NWA World Champion -- Television Champion, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm just trying --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was just going to come to you first because, you know, Thomas Jefferson owned slaves.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I figured I should come to you first.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Last time I saw Thomas Jefferson in the supermarket. It was awkward.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. So what do you -- what is, you know, you see New York, it's going -- it's hell in a handbasket. And that's an insult to hell.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: No, you know what. It always -- it seems to me that the new excuse for not doing anything is to once again bring up slavery. So we had to get rid of Thomas Jefferson because he did what at the time, was fashionable or was what happened. There was -- I hate to even say this, but it's true, there was even black slave owners because that's what society was. The good news was that -- or is that we didn't do that and it didn't take us. We move past it in record time, if you look at the other world, other places on this -- on this world how long they dealt with slavery. Centuries, for eons, we got it -- we got our stuff together relatively quick. So I think it's always hilarious that, why are you getting rid of Thomas Jefferson? Well, he owned slaves. Well, OK, so George Washington got to go. Pretty much everyone from that era has to go. But that is better to say you did that. Then help one sick mental person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Get help on the street. But hey, Thomas Jefferson is gone. And here's the deal, the statue that you took away in most cases, keep somebody from getting rained on that you're not helping.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. By the way to your point, the whole Democratic Party has to go because the Democratic Party. The name itself is associated with slavery. They got to change their name to something else, Julie. Like Severely Hung Over Party, which is what you are. You don't smell like tequila though.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: No, I don't. I chewed a lot of gum in the makeup chair. That poor makeup artist has passed out.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can't believe on a -- what's today? Thursday? So that was a Wednesday night for you.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Every night is a Friday night.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So what do you make of this strategy to always like as you see these -- the crime go up in the city, this is almost serious questions. So you only have like 20 --

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: You lost me already. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As crime gets worse wokeism seeks to replace the argument. So you don't notice how everything's getting so bad. Does that make sense? Did I lose you again?

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Wait. I'm sorry. Did you ask -- so first of all, I think it was a huge mistake to put your wife in charge of anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I mean, that's just something I think every husband should know. Ask Tyrus. He'll tell you.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: What the hell?

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I'm just saying.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Oh wait, she doesn't watch. Go ahead, go ahead, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: He lives Barbie Dreamhouse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Like literally. That's where -- and yes, I'm just saying. You're like --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: So, Greg basically, the moral is just keep deflecting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Very democratic of you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: You're welcome. Well, I mean, I'm talking about Mayor de Blasio.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. But it is true.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: But it is true. And I have to say this. First of all, he needs to concentrate more on the war on crime instead of the war on history. And I believe that Thomas Jefferson statue obviously represents a stain in American history but it's also a reminder of where we've come. Man, this is deep for hung over. Man, my head is spinning. But we have come a long way. We have a long way to go and to remove that is absolutely ridiculous. She should actually remove her husband. Like banish him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I mean, if you're going to give her control, you know, make her - - make the best out of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Welcome to the show, Michael. This your first time. I hope this hasn't disgusted you yet. I look at the amount of time that is devoted to statues and other symbols and I realize that is taken away. It -- it's not like it's a -- it's a pie of time that leaders have. So the more time you spend doing this stuff, you can't help citizens. It's a terrible -- it's a terrible thing to do.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL SHELLENBERGER, AUTHOR, SAN FRAN-SICKO
utterances.sentences: That's what -- I mean, in San Fran-sicko I described how the school board spent much of last year trying to rename the schools rather than trying to figure out how to get the kids back in the classroom. And so we've seen, yes, African-American math proficiency in San Francisco high schools is 12 percent. And so they spend their time basically trying to make everybody feel guilty. It's all deflection all distraction it's a bad situation. So it's sad to see it arrive in New York too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's -- well it's in every major city that is run by a Democrat, Kat. I blame you.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No. Don't -- that is wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Because -- no, and I will tell you why, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Look, OK, it's bad on the streets in New York. It's very, very bad. And, you know, people walk down the street and you see it. People will yell at you. And I am saying it's bad and that said something because first of all, I normally enjoyed attention of any kind.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And second of all, I have dated at least one homeless man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Possibly true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Possibly too. The other one we weren't sure about -- no proof of the apartment, right? So what I'm saying is --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I have done more right for the homeless than all of (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Give her the 800 million.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Believe me. Believe me I have done more. And I will make sure my husband does not watch this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Does living in a car counted as homeless?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: No. And I did it for free too.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: That's a great question, Greg. Is living in a car I mean you're homeless or an explorer?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They also didn't have cars.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Up next. Hip hip hooray Rogen demolished Sanjay?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He took up poop da on Gupta. Thank you. That was mine. Add CNN to the list of list of things Joe Rogan now owns. I speak with CNN's Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta who admitted to Joe Rogan that it was wrong for the network, including Don Lemon and Jim Acosta to claim Rogen took horse dewormer as a COVID treatment. Last month, Rogan announced he test positive for the virus and had been prescribed several drugs to find it including Ivermectin. Now, that drug is FDA approved for use in humans for certain infectious diseases. And the formula for animal use is much more concentrated. But that's not what Rogan was taken. But CNN didn't care and lied about it and said Rogen was taking horse pills. On Wednesday, he called them out.

utterances.speaker: JOE ROGAN, HOST, THE JOE ROGAN EXPERIENCE
utterances.sentences: Lying at your network about people taking human drugs versus drugs --

utterances.speaker: SANJAY GUPTA, CNN CHIEF MEDICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Calling it a horse to wormer is not a flattering thing. I get that.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: It's a lie. It's a lie on a news network. You're talking about a drug that's been given out to billions and billions of people. A drug that was responsible for one of the inventors of it making the --

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: Nobel Prize.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Nobel Prize in 2015.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Why would they lie and say that's horse dewormer? I can afford people medicine (BLEEP) this is ridiculous. It's just a lie.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: I don't you think anyone is (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: But don't you think that a lie like that is dangerous on a news network when you know that they know they're lying? You know that they know that I took medicine like here it is. This is Ivermectin.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Somebody gave it to me.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: All right, hang on. I -- do you -- the thing is, we're like going so fast.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, we are going so fast. But Rogan didn't let up.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Do you think that that's a problem that your news network lies?

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't -- I don't --

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Dude.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: What did they say?

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: They lie. They say I was taking course dewormer. First of all, it was prescribed to me by a doctor.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Along a bunch of other medications.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: If you got a human pill because there are people that were taking the veterinary medication and I -- you're not, obviously. You got it from a doctor. So that it shouldn't be called that. Ivermectin can be a very effective medication. They shouldn't have said that.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Why did they do that?

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: You didn't ask? You didn't think you're the (INAUDIBLE) guy over there.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: I didn't ask. I should have asked before coming in --

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: But they did it with such glee.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, you did. I watched.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I haven't seen a doctor get that traumatized since my last prostate exam. But jokes work. What do you know? Now the takeaway here is that it's not about the efficacy of the drug in question. It's that a network host a guy they don't like. And now that guy who has a massive following of his own push back and push back hard. And now you know why CNN's legion of scolds never ventured out of their network caves. CNN attempted to pick a fight with someone with a bigger audience and a bigger brain and got punched in the mouth right back. They tried to treat Rogan like a smiling kid in a MAGA hat. He's not. He's a hyper focus guy who does mixed martial arts for fun. I find it all to be glorious and refreshing. Like when my buddy self feeds his neighbors.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you want them? Crunch, crunch. Here you go. Watch your head. This guy sitting down over here. It's crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I love the ending. It's crazy. Oh, geez. Michael, so you've done - - you've done Joe Rogan's podcast. Joe's been like incorrect on some things but it's not because he's lying. It's because he didn't have enough information. The difference is that CNN is knowingly -- being wrong about this. Why do you think they did that?

utterances.speaker: SHELLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: Oh, I mean, they hate Joe Rogan because they can't control him. I mean, Joe always makes this joke that he's the stupid guy but when you're with him you realize that he's genius is that he's so terrifying. You really -- he's like a human lie detector, like you don't want to lie in front of that guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SHELLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: And you're in stamina. I mean, you're there for like three hours. You're just kind of like whatever you -- whatever you need to hear from me. You know, it better be the truth or you might break me in half.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I could never do that. I mean, how -- you -- how long were you on with him?

utterances.speaker: SHELLENBERGER
utterances.sentences: We were --I was on -- we were off for 2-1/2 hours then he goes now let's talk about nuclear power. And I was like -- I was like, I'm out. What do I need to do to signal that you win? Tapping. I'm tapping. I'm tapping. Now it was an incredible experience he's a -- he's clearly a genius of the arts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's an -- it's an unusual thing and he didn't even -- it's not like he actively tried to do that. Kat, the thing is I -- to Michael's point, I get the feeling that like Rogan is kind of like what CNN was supposed to be. Like CNN was like the news, but it's not the news anymore. It's all ideology. And now you have these two, three-hour conversations were people -- that was actually a good conversation with Gupta, right?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUPTA
utterances.sentences: So he is the new CNN.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. And CNN is actually doing all the things are creating a lot of the harms that it complains about. So they talk about this horse dewormer thing all the time because it's supposedly bad. They want people to take horse dewormer. That's what they care about. But by saying that Joe Rogan took horse dewormer because he's OK, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They're actually going to be sending the message that taking horse deowemer is OK. Not the people who acknowledge the difference between a human prescription for Ivermectin and veterinary horse dewormer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Would it be funny if the horse dewormer was actually better than the human dewormer?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: That would be hilarious.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It would be hilarious.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes. But, you know what's even more hilarious is that Gupta basically seems to me like a nice guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And you would think nice guys would have a better defense against the truth.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: But even nice guys like their paychecks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And I was waiting for (INAUDIBLE) hey, man, I just got a book deal with them. I just signed new thing. Whoa, whoa, hey, hey, didn't we talk about this in the back? Please. hey, CNN. He was Literally on one of the shows that they were talking about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: The thing about Joe Rogan that makes him so special right now and it shouldn't make him special is that he's being a grown ass man. If you -- if you come at me, I'm going to come at you back and he's even asking why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: And they --- the goal of CNN was to cancel Joe. The best part of this, the side, the accoutrement of this is that Brian Stelter got destroyed because he ripped -- we didn't cover, we didn't see it, but he ripped on Brian so bad the last time that Stelter came on, he had the lowest ratings ever. He had like six people. Three -- one of them was the postage guy. The other one was like his parents. Like he canceled the canceler.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: So that to me in itself is beauty.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Because they got a taste of their own medicine and they don't like it. So maybe they need some horse dewormer because they're clearly full (BLEEP)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know why I'm going to ask you this, Julie. But I have a feeling. Have you ever tried veterinarian pills? Like pills that -- because I have. I have I've taken pills that were designed for another species.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I don't think a horse dewormer, calling it a horse dewormer is a responsible thing to do on cable news. I've -- my dog had worms once.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I'll never get the image out of my head. Like I'm not kidding. Like a little white worms coming out of poop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: But I think it's also odd. That's so fun to talk about. I also think it's so very strange for people to be getting medical advice from cable news doctors.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Although I did listen to him very intently and I recall at the height of the pandemic. Thank you, Sanjay Gupta for teaching me how to take disinfectant wipes and wipe down my frozen peas because that saved my life. So I'm actually -- I wouldn't be here today if it wouldn't for Sanjay Gupta.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: God. Remember that? Wiping down all the surfaces.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I literally. My cereal boxes which then became wet and soggy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My wife would leave the groceries outside the house and we had to take them in one by one.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS

And the people you're supposed to be helping are doing squat everywhere, on the sidewalks, in front of businesses, in the parks with dogs. And that's Julie. So, you go after this statues? And why? How does removing the statues make the poor or the elderly currently being picked off in New York any safer? It doesn't. If anything, with you getting shot at statues give you a place to hide behind. In fact, we can use a lot more statues of really fat people. Grover Cleveland, Henry VIII, hell, I'll take a Michael Moore. It's a good grift as long as you go woke, you're immune from criticism for the horrible messes that you leave behind. I wonder what the angry black male thinks.
